text: The president of Senegal is the head of state and head of government of Senegal. In accordance with the constitutional reform of 2001, and since a referendum that took place on 20 March 2016, the president is elected for a 5-year term, and limited to two consecutive terms.The following is a list of presidents of Senegal, since the country gained independence from France in 1960. thumb|Palace of the Republic ==Key== ;Political parties * * * ;Symbols * Elected unopposed ==Presidents of Senegal (1960–present)== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" ! rowspan="2" | ! rowspan="2" |Portrait ! rowspan="2" |Name ! rowspan="2" |Elected ! colspan="3" |Term of office ! rowspan="2" |Political party ! rowspan="2" |Prime ministers |- !Took office !Left office !Time in office |- ! style="background-color:; color:white;"| 1 | 80px || Léopold Sédar Senghor | 1978|| 6 September 1960 || 31 December 1980 | |PSS |Mamadou Dia Abdou Diouf |- ! style="background-color:; color:white;"| 2 | 80px || Abdou Diouf | 1983 1988 1993|| 1 January 1981 || 1 April 2000 | |PSS |Habib Thiam Moustapha Niasse Habib Thiam Moustapha Niasse |- ! style="background-color:; color:white;"| 3 | 80px || Abdoulaye Wade | 2000 2007|| 1 April 2000 || 2 April 2012 | |PDS |Moustapha Niasse Mame Madior Boye Idrissa Seck Macky Sall Cheikh Hadjibou Soumaré Souleymane Ndéné Ndiaye |- ! style="background-color:; color:white;"| 4 | 80px || Macky Sall | 2012 2019|| 2 April 2012 || Incumbent | |APR |Abdoul Mbaye Aminata Touré Mohamed Dionne Position abolished |} ==Timeline== == Latest election == ==See also== *Senegal **Prime Minister of Senegal **First Lady of Senegal **List of colonial governors of Senegal **Politics of Senegal *Lists of office-holders == References == ==External links== *World Statesmen – Senegal Senegal Category:Government of Senegal Presidents Category:1960 establishments in Senegal
title: List of presidents of Senegal
